comment: Lemma for ~ setrec1 . This is a utility theorem showing the equivalence of the statement ` X e. Y ` and its expanded form. The proof uses ~ elabg and equivalence theorems. Variable ` Y ` is the class of sets ` y ` that are recursively generated by the function ` F ` . In other words, ` y e. Y ` iff by starting with the empty set and repeatedly applying ` F ` to subsets ` w ` of our set, we will eventually generate all the elements of ` Y ` . In this theorem, ` X ` is any element of ` Y ` , and ` V ` is any class. (Contributed by Emmett Weisz, 16-Oct-2020.) (New usage is discouraged.)
